q: ( Reuters)- Chrysler Group Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne vowed on Tuesday to keep the automaker on top of the minivan market in North America and said the company would develop a new type of minivan by 2014. We're not going to give one inch of territory in terms of our domination of( the minivan) segment, Sergio Marchionne told workers at the Windsor Assembly Plant, where the Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town& Country minivans are made. Chrysler, which popularized minivans in 1983 under former CEO Lee Iacocca , will`` rethink

relied on incentives. Chrysler is calling for net revenues of$ 55 billion in 2011; operating profit is expected to be$ 2 billion. Sergio Marchionne said that despite the automaker's progress, our job is not yet done. We have a lot of work ahead to fulfill our five-year business plan objectives.
Performance bonuses OK'd
The focus now is on consumer acceptance of the new lineup. Sergio Marchionne exhausted his staff developing 2011 models, which is why he encouraged the board to approve performance bonuses.
